page.title: 10CHANGING TIMES
page.content: In {Hanbury }thirty years ago very few people could afford holidays. Those who could spent a week at a seaside resort in England hardly anyone went abroad. Sundays were occupied by going to church although most of the farming community had to work as usual. Most village people travelled to work on bicycles or used the bus if they wanted to go further afield to Droitwich or Bromsgrove to visit the cinema. Today there is no regular bus service in the village and most people use private cars. There used to be one shop in the village which also served as the Post Office together with a telephone exchange.
